key_points: Rory McIlroy emphasized the importance of Tiger Woods' survival over his return to golf following a car crash.
Woods suffered significant injuries, including multiple fractures and a shattered ankle, requiring surgery.
Despite speculation on his professional future, McIlroy expressed relief Woods' accident wasn't fatal.
McIlroy highlighted Woods' humanity and previous struggles, underlining the significance of his survival.
The accident drew massive attention, overshadowing the WGC-Workday Championship in Florida.
Speculation exists on whether Woods can return to compete at the highest level after his recovery.
McIlroy believes Woods will continue to impact golf even if he doesn't return to competitive play.
Woods' foundation, golf course design business, and tournament hosting were mentioned as ways he could remain influential.
McIlroy compared Woods' 2019 Masters victory post-spinal fusion surgery to Ben Hogan's comeback, deeming Woods' return as one of the greatest in sports.
Woods' recovery journey from spinal surgery to winning the Masters was highlighted as an extraordinary comeback.
